body:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/18080164/133384280-2832e887-82fc-4bde-bd29-0ee2aa553783.png)

this is slightly out of date in terms of naming schemes but should give a general idea of architecture

Hi @anthony-sarkis,

I am able to establish a connection with OCI Bucket. I am getting an error after docker pull at **"Creating diffgram_default_1 ... error"**
![diffgram_install](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/23217704/133749774-52d9b0eb-136f-4a37-83fb-6e32475ff60d.png)

Hi @aniketzz,

Awesome, looks like you're almost there! I was checking the code for the `docker-compose.yaml` file and bascially the only volume that exists is this one:

```
    volumes:
    - ${GCP_SERVICE_ACCOUNT_FILE_PATH}:/gcp/gcp-service-account.json
```

So maybe the problem is that the `GCP_SERVICE_ACCOUNT_FILE_PATH` variable is not getting set to a long enough name. I would try to set it to something like `/dev/null`. You can check the `populate_env()` function in the `install.py` to see how we are generating it for other provicers different from `gcp`

Thanks, @PJEstrada,

I missed adding the OCI Credentials to `env_file` in `populate_env()`. Once I add The OCI credentials, the setup ran without any error.
I have added them on the docker-compose.yaml as well.

issue.title: Support for static local storage

repository.name: diffgram
repository.description: Training Data (Annotation, Catalog, Workflow) for all Data Types (Image, Video, 3D, Text, Geo, Audio, more) at scale.

issue.body: The data is private and maintained locally, will this be implemented?

body:
Hey @aniketzz !

Did you manage to add oracle storage to? Would you like to create a PR on this?
